column4: Hello everyone, i am running Ubuntu Hardy, and i have the latest update of Wine, but for some reason, my cursor is hidden behind all Wine windows
try turning on the option for enabling apps to stop mouse from leaving window
and try asking your question at #winehq
i have enabled it and have asked in #winehq but they said to ask here
do you have any custom cursor ?? did you try without that option ?? are you using any of the desktop effects ?
i have no custom cursors, and all effects are off. im using Gnome on Ubuntu, but i get the same problem with KDE
type faster I gotta go soon
i dont have a graphics card at all
what gives signal to ur monitor then ?
thats what i got told when i bought the laptop
dude you cant turn on ur laptop without the GPU. If its not separated then u got integrated one.
well i have an integrated one then
then I suppose u didnt install proper graphic drivers.
you should check on ubuntuforums about ur graphic card and driver installation and wine compatibility
i installed everything it asked me to, Ubuntu works fine, just wine that dosent
thats all I can help you atm. I'm out and good luck with ur problem
and yeah wine needs properly installed graphic drivers
